intro: Cereus geometrizans var. pugionifer, commonly known as the sword cactus, is a species native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its tall, cylindrical stems that are often ribbed and covered in spines. The plant produces large, white, funnel-shaped flowers that open at night, attracting nocturnal pollinators. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires minimal water, making it well-suited for arid environments. Its unique appearance and nocturnal blooming make it a striking addition to succulent gardens.
